What is the difference between liability coverage and comprehensive coverage?
Liability coverage pays for damages that you are liable for in an accident, while comprehensive coverage pays for damages to your car that are not caused by an accident, such as weather-related damages or theft.

QnA:
What is flood insurance?

Flood insurance is insurance that helps protect your home and belongings from damage caused by flooding. It can help pay to repair or replace your home and belongings if they are damaged or destroyed by a flood.
customer_question: What is flood insurance?
agent_reply: Flood insurance is insurance that helps protect your home and belongings from damage caused by flooding. It can help pay to repair or replace your home and belongings if they are damaged or destroyed by a flood.

QnA:
Why do I need flood insurance?

Floods are one of the most common natural disasters in the United States. Even if you live in an area that is not prone to flooding, you may still be at risk. Flooding can occur anywhere, anytime, and often without warning. That's why it's important to have flood insurance, even if your mortgage lender doesn't require it.
customer_question: Why do I need flood insurance?
agent_reply: Floods are one of the most common natural disasters in the United States. Even if you live in an area that is not prone to flooding, you may still be at risk. What does flood insurance cover?

Flood insurance can help cover the cost to repair or replace your home and belongings if they are damaged or destroyed by a flood. It can also help pay for temporary living expenses if your home is uninhabitable due to flood damage.
customer_question: What does flood insurance cover?

QnA:
What does flood insurance not cover?

Flood insurance does not cover damage caused by water that enters your home through windows or doors. It also does not cover damage to your home's foundation, garage, or other structures not attached to your home.
customer_question: What does flood insurance not cover?

QnA: Customer: What does my insurance policy cover?
agent_reply: Your insurance policy documents detail what is covered, including limitations and exclusions. For specifics, refer to your policy or contact your insurance provider.

QnA: Customer:When does my policy expire?
agent_reply: Your policy expires on [expiration date]. You'll receive a renewal notice prior to that date.

QnA: Customer:How much am I covered for?
customer_question: Customer: how can I reniew the policy again.
agent_reply: You're covered for up to [coverage limit] for [specific coverage].

QnA: Can I add or remove coverage options?
customer_question: customer: Can I add or remove coverage options?
agent_reply: Yes, you can add or remove coverage options. Please visit [website] or contact customer support for assistance.

QnA: How can I renew my policy?
agent_reply: Your policy will automatically renew unless you choose to make changes. You'll receive renewal instructions prior to the expiration date.

QnA: What are the terms and conditions of my policy?
agent_reply: You can find the terms and conditions outlined in your policy documents. They're also available on our website.

QnA: Can I transfer my insurance policy to another person?
agent_reply: Insurance policies are generally non-transferable, but you may be able to assign benefits through a legal process called "assignment," subject to approval.

QnA: What happens if I sell my insured property or vehicle?
agent_reply: Notify us if you sell your insured property or vehicle to cancel or transfer coverage. The new owner will need their own insurance.

QnA: How do I update my beneficiaries on my life insurance policy?
agent_reply: You can update beneficiaries on your life insurance policy by contacting us for a beneficiary change form.

QnA: Can I pause my insurance coverage temporarily?
agent_reply: Insurance coverage cannot usually be paused, but we can help adjust your coverage or payment plans to suit your needs.

QnA: What should I do if I move to a different state or country?
agent_reply: Please inform us promptly when you move to update or change your coverage based on your new location.

QnA: Are there any restrictions on coverage if I rent out my property?
agent_reply: Renting out your property may require additional coverage like landlord insurance. Contact us to ensure proper coverage.

QnA: What steps should I take if I want to add a new driver to my policy?
agent_reply: Adding a new driver requires providing their details for adjustment to your policy and possibly changing your premium. Let us assist you with that.

QnA: Can I switch to a different type of insurance policy mid-term?
agent_reply: Switching insurance types mid-term is subject to your policy terms. Feel free to reach out to us to explore the options available.

QnA: How do I know if my policy covers a specific type of damage or loss?
agent_reply: Review your policy documents or contact us to understand specific types of damage or loss covered.

QnA: What happens to my policy if I make significant renovations to my property?
agent_reply: Inform us of significant property renovations to adjust coverage and ensure protection against increased risks. We're here to help with that.

QnA: How long do I have to report an incident and file a claim?
agent_reply: You should report an incident and file a claim as soon as possible, typically within a few days to a week, but timelines may vary depending on your policy.

QnA: What documents are typically required when filing a claim?
agent_reply: When filing a claim, you may typically need documents such as a claim form, incident report, photos or videos of the damage, and any relevant receipts or estimates.

QnA: Can I track the progress of my claim online?
agent_reply: Some insurance companies offer online claim tracking, allowing you to monitor the progress of your claim in real-time through their website or mobile app.

QnA: How are claims payouts determined?
agent_reply: Claims payouts are determined based on various factors including the extent of damage or loss, your policy coverage limits, deductibles, and any applicable exclusions.

QnA: What options do I have if my claim is denied?
agent_reply: If your claim is denied, you can appeal the decision with your insurance company or seek assistance from a third-party mediator or legal counsel.

QnA: Is there a time limit for filing a claim for severe weather?
agent_reply: Time limits for severe weather claims vary depending on your policy and insurer, so check your policy documents or contact your insurer for specific information.

QnA: Do I need to pay a deductible for every type of claim?
agent_reply: Deductibles typically apply to each type of claim, but the amount may vary depending on your policy terms and the nature of the claim.

QnA: How do I file a claim for medical expenses from an accident?
agent_reply: To file a claim for medical expenses resulting from an accident, submit relevant medical records, bills, and receipts to your insurer along with a claim form.

QnA: Can I file a claim for damages caused by vandalism/theft?
agent_reply: Yes, you can typically file a claim for damages caused by vandalism or theft, providing evidence such as a police report and documentation of the damage or stolen items.

QnA: What should I do if I'm involved in a hit-and-run accident?
agent_reply: Report the incident to the police immediately, then notify your insurer to file a claim and follow their instructions for documentation and resolution.
